data.event: In July 1854, John W. Brown came to this area and found it highly suitable for a homestead.

event.title: 1856, Mr. Brown along with M. C. Dickey, Loring Farnsworth and Henry Fox pre-empted

data.event: In 1856, Mr. Brown along with M. C. Dickey, Loring Farnsworth and Henry Fox pre-empted 320 acres (1.3 km2) for the purpose of a town.
In 1848 the government set up a new mission a few miles west of Topeka.

event.title: fall of 1854, he and his wife had retired

data.event: In the fall of 1854, he and his wife had retired from active work in the Pottawatomie Mission, to homestead on 160 acres (0.6 km2)southwest of the town.
